name: Bitty
desc: Fort Lauderdale-based MCA funder (est. 2018). 29K+ small businesses funded, ~$165M originated in 2023. OppFi holds 35% equity ($15.25M, Aug 2024) with option for full ownership by 2030. CEO Craig Hecker is industry veteran who founded/sold Rapid Capital Funding. Daniel Dames (VP Ops) speaking on Funder Panel.
notes: Funder Panel speaker — warm lead, high priority.

news.h: OppFi acquires 35% equity stake in Bitty for ~$18M
news.d: OppFi paid $15.25M cash + $2.7M stock for 35% stake. Options to increase to full ownership by 2030.

news.h: Bitty launches fixed-term small business loan program
news.d: New installment-style loan rolling out Sept 2025, starting in Texas. Complements existing revenue-based financing.

news.h: Cloudsquare CRM integrates with Bitty Advance via API
news.d: Salesforce-powered broker CRM added direct API for automated submissions and same-day approvals.

ice: Craig, Daniel -- congrats on the OppFi partnership and 29K+ businesses funded. How are you scaling underwriting to keep up with OppFi’s growth ambitions? — what’s the most surprising trend you’re seeing in small business funding right now?
icebreakers: I saw OppFi took a 35% stake at a 6x multiple on your net income -- that is a strong endorsement. Now with the path to full ownership by 2030, how is that partnership shaping your product roadmap?

Congrats on launching the fixed-term loan product in September. Expanding from pure revenue-based financing into installment loans is a big shift -- are brokers sending you a different borrower profile now?
The Cloudsquare API integration in January is a big deal for broker workflow. Has automated submission changed the volume or quality of deals coming through your ISO channel?
With $420M funded to 29K+ merchants and OppFi backing you with public-company resources, what is the biggest bottleneck to scaling from here -- capital, distribution, or something else?
tp: How are you handling underwriting volume as you scale? We’re seeing funders your size hitting a wall at 40 min per deal manually.
We cut that to under 5 minutes — application intake, cash flow analysis, CLEAR report review, all automated with explainable decisions.
We’re already working with PIRS Capital in this space. Happy to share what we’ve seen work.

leaders.bg: Industry veteran. Founded and sold Rapid Capital Funding. Acquired Bitty in 2020. OppFi holds 35% equity with path to full ownership.
UPitt CS + Psychology. Previously at PNC, Compunetix. Tech background makes him receptive to automation. Funder Panel speaker.
8+ years consulting in consumer/business finance. Oversees all digital marketing.

ask: Would it be worth a 20-minute demo next week to show you the platform?

ice: Shaya, I’ve been wanting to connect — debt consolidation underwriting is one of the most complex niches in this space, and that’s exactly where our AI shines.
icebreakers: The Franklin/Capstone two-fund model is smart -- clean up the MCA stack, then step in with growth capital. How often does a merchant graduate from one fund to the other?

Your Capstone Fund targets businesses through distress into growth but still outside traditional bank eligibility. What does your qualification process focus on that banks miss?
I have been listening to your Back to Business podcast. Is it bringing inbound deal flow or more of a culture and recruiting play?
tp: Debt consolidation underwriting is uniquely complex — analyzing a merchant’s existing MCA stack with multiple advances and factor rates. Our AI parses bank statements and automatically identifies all MCA repayments.
With two funds needing different risk models, you need configurable underwriting workflows. That’s exactly what we do.
For a 16-person team, going from 40 min to 5 min per deal is transformative. That’s like adding 5 more underwriters without the headcount.

leaders.bg: Wayne State accounting. Founded/sold tax prep company at 19. Acquired Franklin Capital 2004. EY Entrepreneur of Year 2022 finalist.

news.h: NY Attorney General Announces $1.065 Billion Settlement with Yellowstone Capital

news.h: Yellowstone Capital Leadership Permanently Banned from MCA Industry
